revised_title: The Influence of Temperature and Gas on the Evaporation Rate of Di-n-Butyl Phthalate Drops
tldr: This study investigates the rate of evaporation of di-n-butyl phthalate drops and how it is influenced by changes in temperature and the surrounding gas. The researchers found that the evaporation rate increases with higher temperatures and lower air pressure. They also discovered that the diffusion coefficient in air for di-n-butyl phthalate is 76 cm²/s, and the evaporation coefficient is unity at temperatures between 15 to 60°C. The findings contribute to a better understanding of the evaporation process and can be applied to other substances and situations.
